reviews.review: Bioshock Infinite is, well, Jack Skellington sang it right: "What's this? What's this? There's colour everywhere." Or shinies. To sum and clear things: Bioshock Infinite is a shooter with "spells" aka vigors and melee. Player is free to choose how to survive in fights by using different kind of guns, vigors and melee. The freedom to choose and the freedom to use are the best things in Bioshock Infinite. In addition, one is free to upgrade guns/vigors/suit as one likes with (money/finding gear) limits, of course. Game itself has only few side quests and runs in a tunnel vision, but I was still able to spend +20 hours with this game (10h for runners) mostly because of shinies: "sniff sniff, what's here? What's that? Shiny! Glimmering! Must search this box and that drawer." Because of this, I didn't really focus on the plot and I often missed the start of the fights. Anywho, the game has a plot and it is somewhat interesting. Skip this game if Hollywood-ish action games are not your thing.

Primarily speaking, this game is very well built, unlike most of the classic FPS games, the storyline achieves to keep your attention until the end while continiously offering twists and suprises during the gameplay. The plot is well written and I find the general atmosphere satisfactory. Special skills and sound effects are very well implemented. The colors and graphics are very good quality; not so dark and smothering unlike contemporary FPS games. Lots of effort has been made by the designers. Only down part would be the short gaming time but it depends mostly how you advance during the story mode. I would merit 4 out of 5 to this game and would say it worths your money.

Bioshock Infinite обладает изумительным стилем, очень интересным сюжетом, великолепной озвучкой, чудесным видеорядом и хорошей режиссурой. Тем обиднее, что на фоне этих роскошеств он очень простецкий как игра и совершенно не может очаровать пресловутым геймплеем. Не то чтобы приходится терпеть несложный шутан ради интересной истории, но  уж наслаждаться именно пострелушками не выходит. Жаль, что они составляют основу процесса.
Тем не менее, очень рекомендую к покупке - в конце концов, стиль, сюжет, картинка и режиссура стоят того. Bioshock однозначно сумеет положительно удивить.

Bioshock madura bastante en este título, tras el estrepitoso "fracaso" de su segunda entrega. La historia es realmente interesante y aunque la jugabilidad vuelve a ser básicamente el eliminar a los enemigos, ésta se hace más intensa y entretenida. No es algo brillante, pero si una historia que al fin mejora la importante tarea iniciada con el original bioshock.

8.2/10
Breathtaking

Wer die ersten Bioshock-Teile gespielt haben wird, wird Bioshock Infinite erst einmal skeptisch gegenüber stehen. War doch die Atmosphäre in den ersten Teilen unschlagbar düster und stimmig. Eine Stadt in den Wolken, bunt und in hellen Pastellfarben gehalten kann doch da nicht mithalten, oder?

Weit gefehlt: 

Meiner Meinung nach ist es diesmal weder das Gameplay, die Location noch die Grafik welche das Spiel besonders machen. Vielmehr sind es die ausgezeichnete Story, die hervorragenden Dialoge (auch in Deutsch) und die wirklich feingezeichneten Charaktere welche das Spiel wieder einmal zu einem wahren Kunstwerk machen und den Spieler unmittelbar in die Spielwelt eintauchen lässt.

Zusammen mit den DLC's welche einen wieder zurück nach Rapture bringen, wird man am Ende von der Story tatsächlich geplättet inkl. genügen Diskussions-Stoff ;-) 

Dafür gibt es 

Grafik: 07/10
Sound: 06/10 (5.1 Setup kommen die Stimmen nie aus dem Center)
Gameplay: 07/10 
Story: 10/10

Übrigens: Wer Lust hat über die Story zu philosophieren kann sich gerne bei mir melden!
This game was GOTY, not GTA V, trust me. The history is absolutely fenomenal. Dude, I can't explain this, just freakin buy it, play it and cry at the end thinking WHY DID IT ENDED!?!?!
Я кончил!

Before I played the game I watched trailers and read reviews and they are right.

First things first is the graphics, they are detailed with nice lightings giving a creamy enviroment.
it always captivates me to see such awesome graphics.
Next is the story which is amazing (if you played bioshock 1,2) its more amazing as all these games connect together and boom, MINDFUCKING.
Characters are really good from their overall viewpoint it is awesome.
WOULD RECOMMEND THIS
Great action, great story, awesome game
Super fun game...  I recommend it!!!
bet game ever

Capolavoro! Va giocato per capirlo, il gameplay mantiene le stesse basi ma è molto cambiato e migliorato, la mappe d'azione sono molto più grandi la grafica è eccelente e l'ambientazione unica. Un atmosfera viva e pulsante e perfettamente creata. I personaggi credibili nella fantasia e curatissimi, Elizabeth e forse il miglior compagni di viaggio che potreste mai desiderare in un videogioco, interagisce bene con l'ambiente e si rende utile dandovi rifornimenti e usando i suoi poteri. Una storia fantastica e mozzafiato con una recitazione ottima. Insomma un titolo eccezzionale!

L'espansione burial at sea è anch'essa incredibile ma per apprezzare appieno l'intreccio della storia tra i vari bioshock è importante aver giocato anche il primo.
Прекрасный сюжет в сочетании с не менее прекрасной графикой и атмосферой. Рекомендую.

Schönes Gameplay, nette Grafik und eine verdammt gute Story.
Einmal durchgespielt hat es meiner Meinung kaum wiederspielwert mehr.

Good game that has been console-fied.

Даже не знаю, с чего начать. Наверное, с минусов. Слишком перемудрили с тайниками, я облазил почти всё, а по факту, большую часть тайников не открыл и не нашел. Всю игру не испытывал трудностей с деньгами и апгрейдами, а в конце часто оставался без патронов к любимым пушкам. Пушек, кстати не мало, но даже попробовать какие то новые абсолютно нет желания. Всю игру пробегал с автоматом и улучшенным карабином. С плазмидами та же тема, вроде их не мало, но какие то они одинаковые, в итоге пользовался двумя-тремя от силы. Главный минус - это сюжет. Точнее, он то в порядке, хоть и повторяется, как и в прошлых частях серии. Спойлер!!===Не знаю, видимо Кена Левина самого родители в детстве продали в рабство, ибо его эта тема не отпускает.===Интернет пестрил криками о невероятной концовке, о круто скрученном сужете и пр. Я этого не увидел. Обычная концовка в стиле научной фантастики, которая оставляет, быть может больше вопросов, чем ответов.(тут чувствуется влияние сериала Лост на автора игры)
А теперь про плюсы. Да, сюжет не потряс меня и не впечатлил, как тех школьников, что сначала играли в Инфинит, а потом уже в предидущие части серии, но всёравно, играть было интересно и хотелось знать, что будет дальше, во многом благодаря хорошо продуманному миру игры и героям. Элизабет прекрасна, бегать с ней это одно удовольствие, чувствуешь себя, по настоящему, героем. Несомненно это удачная идея, добавить в игру вот такую харизматичную напарницу. Игра не успевает надоесть ни длительностью, ни врагами, ни безисходностью предидущих частей. Это яркий и красивый мир (моментами ловишь себя на том, что наслаждаешься красотой картинки, забыв про выполнение задачи). Удовольствие игра, полюбому, доставляет. Такие игры ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНО нужно сиграть.

Fun game with great graphics  get it

Gelungene Fortsetzung der ersten beiden Teile.
Bioshock Infinite wirkt im ersten Abschnitt etwas fröhlicher und herzlicher als die Vorgänger, doch mit der Zeit gelingt es die gewohnte düstereStimmung aufzubauen. 
Das Spiel ist äußerst abwechslungsreich gestaltet, die Vielfalt der Kräfte und Waffen sorgen dafür, dass es nie langweilig wird. Die vielen versteckten Gegenstände sorgen dafür, dass der Spieler sich immer ganz genau umsieht und es regt wirklich dazu an, das Spiel ein zweites Mal zu spielen. 
Die Story ist - für mich - zweifellos eine der besten aller Zeiten. Booker und Elizabeth sind Figuren mit denen man sich identifizieren kann und die man von Anfang an ins Herz schließt. 
Die malerische Schönheit von Columbia lässt erkennen, welche grafische Meisterleistung dieses Spiel ist. Auf jeden fall empfehlenswert!

Started off not knowing what to expect. I loved the first Bioshock, the second one not so much. Was this another failed attempt to revive the Bioshock series? Nope, I love this game! The graphics are great, and the game has a intriguing story line. A different approach to the series. Shit, you are in the clouds! A floating city! In case you didn't know what this game is about, let me fill you in on the story line.

BioShock Infinite takes place in 1912 in Columbia, a city suspended in the air through a combination of "quantum levitation" and giant blimps and balloons. It was built and launched in 1901 by the American government under President William McKinley's directive, to much fanfare and publicity. However, it was later involved in an "international incident" by firing upon a group of Chinese civilians during the Boxer Rebellion. The city was disavowed by the United States government, and the location of the city was soon lost to everyone else.

As a result of the city's isolation, a civil war eventually broke out on Columbia between different factions of citizens. At the time of the game's events, only two main factions remain. One group is the Founders, the remnants of those retaining power over the city led by Zachary Hale Comstock, which seeks to keep Columbia purely for American citizens while denying foreigners the same privileges. The other is a group named Vox Populi, a rag-tag resistance group, led by Daisy Fitzroy, formed from several factions with similar ideologies that fought to seize control and restore the rights of Columbia citizenship to all. However, years of war and struggle have driven Vox Populi to fight the powers-that-be solely out of blind hatred, resulting in more violent and brutal methods and leading to subfactions in the group.

The player in Infinite controls Booker DeWitt, a former disgraced member of the Pinkerton National Detective Agency to recover the girl Elizabeth from her captivity aboard Columbia for the last twelve years under Comstock. Booker finds the city in violent political strife and works with Elizabeth to understand why she was held captive and the secrets of Columbia's creation. The story is thematically linked to the previous BioShock games, and a scene within the game as well as upcoming downloadable content for the title revisit the underwater city of Rapture through this connection. The player augments weapons and abilities with Elizabeth's own to aid their escape from the falling city.

I suggest you go ahead and get this game if the story excites you. Well worth the money!
Was a good time killer. Not much more

This game is pure art for me. The gameplay itself has really good ideas that meant to stay away from COD, great places to explore, great storytelling, a few, but very good characters.
At some parts of the game i felt just as shocked as if i was watching some movie that i can imagine myself into, feeling the same way as the character, struggling to survive to do my best.
Maybe the story gets a bit difficult to understand at some places, but after completing the burial at sea expansions....i gotta tell that maybe this is my best single player experience ever ! I even got into mood for some replay....which is strange from me i hate single player games :D
The final part of the game causes Down Sindrome, Cancer, Anorexia and most important, Constipation.
прикольная игра!
Отличная игра.

I think this game is far better then its predecessor. Bioshock 1 was good, nice graphics, decent story, and fun gameplay. Bioshock 2 was a bit disappointing to me. Good graphic, but the gameplay was far to easy and the story felt a bit weak. This one however had stunning graphics, The gameplay was very well done and so much fun. Now the story was the best by far with more plot twists then i have ever seen and a ending that still leaves me in awe. this game is a definite perfect game i must say.

An extremely dumbed down version of previous Bioshock games.  The combat is extremely boring/repetitive, and the battles feel so artificial and staged; it really removes you from the game.  The game is way too easy (on hard difficulty), until you get to one particular battle towards the end where you will die a bunch until you figure out how to corner yourself where you're not vulnerable (terrible game design).  The rails aspect seemed like it would be fun, but I found myself rarely using it.  Not a lot of depth in terms of the vigors and combining, although this was probably the most fun aspect of the game.  They changed the weapon system to only give you two at a time, which is fine.  However, because you pay to upgrade particular weapons, you either use those weapons you paid to upgrade the whole time, or spread your invest in upgrades because you'll get bored (or run out of ammo, though this didn't happen much) and keep switching weapons anyway.  It definitely seems like all the effort went into leading you through a particular experience.  The game is set up to just basically lead you through a scripted story.  Fine...

So was the oversimplied combat redeemed by the story?  No... This was one of the most convoluted plots of anything I have ever seen or played.  Why did it have to go down the philosophical rabbit hole?  Silly me, expecting them not to abandon what made the previous games great.  This game story-wise was so close to being great.  I guess it's just me (from seeing these positive comments) but I like when my actions in the game matter and amount to something.  Especially in a game like this where you get emotionally involved in the characters.  But the ending ruined this completely.  It was very clear (especially from the clip after the credits) that your actions mean nothing.  Why have a game with (minimal) choices at all?  A game is not the right medium for this story at all.

Don't get me wrong, I applaud game developers and writers for trying something new.  But the end was just as bad as a Deux Ex Machina, but for the game series I loved.  Anyone who says this is a good "game" hasn't played a good game before.  You might as well just watch a movie like Looper or 12 Monkeys and save yourself about 8 hours.

A pretty good story, was a bit disappointed they abandoned the original mechanics for the game (Basically using Elizabeth abilities can result in her dying or good ending bad ending scnerio). Plus I feel they put to many safety nets to prevent you from easy death like on the skyrail, but ohwell. The gameplay and storyline didn't disappoint me entirely, the DLC made up on it alittle and the bonuses you get were fun. To my opinion its no where near worth its price simply to the fact its an easy game, but if your a fan of the bioshock storyline give it a go with the DLCs ofcourse. The Ending will leave you in tears.

My favorite from the series the change in scenery is remarkably pleasant, with the story being quite complex and original, it's a solid game which also suffers from the previous two games in terms of gunplay which luckly the story and exploration make up for it.

-¿Tienes miedo de Dios?.
- No...pero tu si me das miedo.

Con este pequeño diálogo se abre el telón para un juego que te transportará a las nubes (literalmente).

Bioshock Infinite es sin lugar a dudas un juego que roza la perfección. Para mi lo tiene todo, y por supuesto soy super fan de la saga Bioshock (todo hay que decirlo).

"Una cuenta que saldar", es la excusa perfecta para que el programa nos envuelva y sumerja en su historia, en su mundo. Siendo esta a su vez muy compleja y solo hasta el final del juego recién atarás algunos cabos, y digo algunos porque el juego echa a volar tu imaginación y solo tú podrás interpretar de la mejor forma el por qué de los acontecimientos, las causas, las consecuencias.

No cabe duda de que el Sr. Ken Levine puso todo el sentimiento en esta su obra maestra, su joya (una pena que haya dejado Irrational Games).

Desde los personajes; pasando por la trama, la música, la jugabilidad, los poderes (vigorizadores), los escenarios, los voxáfonos, los gráficos, etc. Todo apartado es de 10.

Elizabeth, nuestra compañera en la aventura y sobre quién gira toda la trama, es el mejor personaje secundario hasta el momento. Recuerdo a Ashley de Resident evil 4 y sencillamente ni punto de comparación.

Siempre habrá momentos en el que te suelte unas líneas, ya sea preguntándote cosas, diciéndote lo que piensa, entre otras más; y lo mejor de todo: IN-GAME. Además es bellísima y el estilo gráfico que posee el juego le da ese toque especial que enamora a cualquiera.

El apartado shooter está más conseguido y pulido que en Bioshock 1; aquí hay mirillas para las armas y siempre puedes utilizar el combo: arma+vigorizador, como ya venía siendo en Bioshock 1 (arma+plásmido). Existe una barra de salud y otra de escudo, las cuales se pueden ir mejorando conforme transcurre el juego; por tanto no existen botiquines, lo cual le quita ese toque extra de dificultad que si tenía el título original.

Si mueres, puedes revivir en la misma zona y sin perder progreso alguno pero pagando el precio por ello: "águilas de plata". Si juegas en el modo 1999 y mueres, regresas al menú principal y reapareces en tu último checkpoint o partida guardada; este es otro punto que no me gustó (guardados automáticos) porque que en Bioshock 1 al desactivar la vita-cámara tenías que estar pendiente de ir guardando tu partida, si te olvidabas, la rabia que te daba de volver hacer todo de nuevo. 

A pesar de estos pequeños puntos negativos, el juego sigue siendo de 10 y totalmente recomendado para todo buen amante de aventuras fantásticas dotadas de una historia a la altura del infinito.

Probablemente el mejor juego que he probado hasta la fecha, lástima que aquí muera la saga.

One of the best games I've played in a while. It is probably the most graphically beautiful game I've ever played. Great action throughout like the previous games. Though it was not based in Rapture, it didn't disappoint as the world was even more beautiful. Great story with an unexpected ending.

Realmente me ha sorprendido, aunque dejemos cosas claras.

1º Para ser un juego FPS resulta algo repetitivo ya que aunque juntemos todas las armas y los poderes no tenemos suficiente variedad; y los enemigos son muy parecidos

2º Cada detalle esta muy cuidado y si bien no son graficazos increibles crea un ambiente muy real y natural.

3º La historia es increible, y no es hasta los ultimos segundos cuando te dejan con la boca abierta.

Por mi parte recomendable si quieres una buena historia sacrificando algo de jugabilidad!! ;)

When I first got the game, I played about 5 hours and got lost at one point and didn't play it again for a while. When I finally played it again I restarted the game and finished it within three days. After I finished the game I bought the Season Pass. Part one of Burial at Sea didn't take very long and at the time of writing this I still haven't finished part two. I can honestly say this has the best storyline and campaign of any game I have played on the pc. The only thing that took away from my experience was the sound quality. For some reason the sound was terrible. Other than that I loved this game and highly recommend it.

I enjoyed first Bioshock like no other game in a long time. Bioshock 2 was also amazing, although not the same masterpiece as the prequel. But Bioshock Infinite left me staring at my screen with my mouth open and the first words was WHAT THE F@#K WAS THAT? I have absolutely no idea what was going on at the end... I enjoyed the story, I enjoyed the fights on skylines, but the end...?

Forse uno dei migliori giochi che abbiamo mai provato.... Dal mio punto di vista io lo ritengo un gran gioco,ho preferito questo capitolo ai primi 2 bioschock sinceramente... intelligenza artificiale abbastanza avanzata elizabeth oltre a essere utile a trovare munizioni,medikit e eve vi potrà aprire degli squarci per avere qualche aiuto extra :) 


SPOILER ALERT!!!


Il finale mi è piaciuto davvero molto.... anche se molto incasinato ne sono riuscito a comprendere una piccola parte... Bella anche la parte in cui mentre si scala la torre passano anni in pochi secondi, davvero un gioco ben riuscito per me 
30 euro li vale non ve ne pentirete :)

멀티엔딩이 아니라는 것 하나 때문에 전작들과 좀 다르고 배경도 컬럼비아라는 새로운 도시.

빅 대디에 필적하는 카리스마의 보스몹이 등장하지 않았던 점도 아쉽다.DLC는 1,2의 배경이기도 하고 1,2 했던 경험이 있어서 최고 난이도로 했는데 너무 어려워서 진행할 수 없을 정도..ㅋㅋ
개인적으로는 1에 비하면 좀 별로고 2와 비슷한 정도의 평가를 하고 싶다.
awesome game

Si vous arrivez à passer à autre chose que Rapture vous serez transporté par ce scénario qui vous poussera à refaire le jeu pour le saisir pleinement. Excellent système de rails, de compétences et de spawns qui rendent les combats différents selon votre envie. Simple magnifique et efficace, ce jeu est un classique bourré de références et de clins d'oeils.

Vengo a escribir esto nada más he acabado el juego. Ánalisis sobre Bioshock infinite... Por donde empezar... Ha pasado mucho tiempo desde que jugué a un videojuego que con el final me daban cada vez más escalofríos y me dejaba un vacío existencial. Desde el principio el juego puede dejarte  con la boca abierta con sus cinemáticas con una calidad gráfica excelente, combates dinámicos con muchas posibilidades gracias a la variedad de armas, vigorizadores..; Excelente diseño de armas y de enemigos, secretos en todos los rincones que te haran dar más de una vuelta para encontrarlo todo, una ambientación logradísima: diálogos de los personajes,  temas candentes como el racismo de la época... Y en medio de todo esto se encuentran nuestros protagonistas: Booker DeWitt y Elizabeth personajes con un trasfondo muy elaborado de los que te enamorarás.

SUCH A GREAT GAME! I would have to say a little slow in the beginning but they did a good job making sure the game had enough background and storyline to keep it going. I don't think I would have ever expected the ending. Recommend it to anyone. Not as spooky as it predecessors, but still a great game.

I've played Bioshock 1 and Infinite. Skipped Bioshock 2. SIMPLY BUY INFINITE 9/10

Bioshock Infinite is one of best story and action driven games ever made. The story itself is full of twists, logical challanges, humurous yet tricky dialogues, humor. This game will test your wits in combat and will challange your intellect to fully grasp what is going on. The game is definetly in top 10 of best games I've ever played. It's not boring. The main story is very interesting, has unique atmosphere and on top of that there are two story based DLC's entitled 'Burial at the Sea EP1 and EP2'. The spoilers will be skipped but this game is too good to be avoided. Everyone should play the game at least once to experience this something, that many games nowadays fail to deliver.

+ Replayability value for STORY and gameplay
+ A lot of action and combat
+ Unique atmosphere
+ Main campaign lasts for 10 hours (95% complete walkthough)
+ Obviously not photorealistic graphic, nevertheless it's very pretty and colorful
+ Sounds in game are plentiful but not messy, quite fitting music to the game world
+ Two story DLC's that take place before Bioshock 1, kind of introduction.

- Game tends to stutter and one has to find fix on google
- Numerous bugs on 'Burial at the Sea EP2'
- Antialiasing: dont enable it is FXAA which blurs image ruining its quality. Makes textures blurry and not clear to see, blurring hits negatively color palette and the worst thing, it's less effective than MSAA x2 in any other game.

Neutral: There are some choices in the game, but it's linear. Nevertheless the game is not boring at all and is very enjoyable.

To sum up my review, this game is an unforgettable experience that may make one think about the plot or even replaying the game again and again. 9/10
It's best to buy the game with season pass in a bundle on sale for 16€. Even with the full price of 50€, the game is just worth it if you're fan of great and unforgettable story in games.
Holy shit the ending will put your brain in mindfuck of a lifetime          get the game
Good story plot if you understand the concept of time, space and dimension

Amazing plot, beautiful graphics and fun gameplay. Only short coming is lack of any need for vigors unless you are playing on Hard or 1999 Mode.

Good length of game no matter the price, and arguably as good as Bioshock 1.

+F***ing gorgeous ass visuals
Cons:

Final Verdict: A very welcome addition to the Bioshock series. Even though it waters down a lot of the the original's game mechanics, Infinite is still a game that is very enjoyable. You would be a fool to miss out on this game.

great game lots of fun but once completed its difficult to enjoy a second playthrough

While my feelings for Bioshock: Infinite are a bit mixed I do recommend that you check this game out.

Compared to Bioshock (1) the Vigors (plasmids) and weapons don't feel nearly as inspired.  There are less overall Vigors than in 1 and they seemed all around less useful than the plasmids of Bioshock.  The effects are minimal and I never felt like they contributed much in combat aside from minor effects like stunning an enemy or increasing how much damage the baddies took, which is a shame really.  Elsewhere, there are more types of guns but the amount of customization is much more limited.  There are no longer multiple ammo types and the weapon mods (upgrades) are very strict: each gun has 4 unique upgrades that unlock as you progress through the game but must be purchased.  Finally, tonics are mostly replaced by a new mechanic called Gear.  Gear can be changed at any time and confers similar effects to tonics.  Four pieces of gear can be worn at one time, but these pieces fill specific slots (hat body legs boots).  The effects of gear seemed to be expanded upon past the tonics of Bioshock.

As a warning this game is very story heavy.  The pacing is much slower at the start than it is in Bioshock and this is both good and bad.  I didn't feel like I was playing a game for a long time, and even after I was the actual gameplay was so divided by long story segments that I wondered if the gameplay was getting in the way of the story that Infinite wanteed to tell.  This clears up about a third to halfway into the game but that's a long time before it actually happens.

That being said I did enjoy the story even if it did get a little bullshity near the end.  While it's not the most original I applaud that the themes and ideas present were used in a video game, at least until the very end.  Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the ending but it seemed a bit contrived, defying sense and logic.  It did make me want to go replay the game and understand the significance of everything, but eh, lazy.  Ah, and the characters are fantastic as are there interactions.

Combat is more or less the same as it was in Bioshock: you shoot things and then they die.  The enemy that replaced the Big Daddy is terrifying but it also only shows up a few times within the story.  Normal enemies make a lot more sense in Infinite than they did in Bioshock.  I understood why I was fighting what I was and why they were there/attacking me in 1 but the enemies in Infinite just fit a lot better.  Later "normal" enemies infuriated me at times because they would take more than an entire clip to their face at point blank before they would go down, but whatever, you get over it.

The sky line system is interesting but I would have liked to see it expanded a bit more as it rarely comes into play.  Sure, in some combat situations it opens up the battlefield a lot and creates for some cool moments but I never felt like the sky lines were fully implemented.  That is to say, they felt out of place in their own game: their existence in a lot of places didn't make a lot of sense and from a story point they didn't seem to frequent or connect enough areas.  Early on you use them to move from one area to another but after that they mostly stay confined to a battle arena.  Shame, really.

Oh, and the game is gorgeous.  The setting is ok; if it had been more open I would have received it better than I did, but you're never really given an opportunity to explore.  Everything is linear and you see exactly what the developers want you to.  Because of the linearity I didn't feel like I was exploring a city in the clouds so much.  In fact, I felt more confined in Infinite than I ever did in Bioshock, though maybe that is partially due to the ability to backtrack.  Ah well.

Yeah, Bioshock is a good game, possibily even great, but it's not without flaws.  You should almost certainly check it out and it's definitely a game that's worth talking about.
Gr8 game love it! look at the graphics for example!

[h1] Бесконечность [/h1]

[b] Очень неоднозначная игра... [/b]
 
Поначалу казалось весьма скучным шутаном, с неплохой графикой и невнятным сюжетом. В какой-то момент даже не захотелось ее проходить, но игра очень грамотно набирает обороты. Начинается все достаточно непонятно с маяка на котором мы находим труп, потом проигрываем мелодию и отправляемся к [spoiler]ебеням [/spoiler](без шуток). Эта Колумбия... Если её так можно назвать, весьма странная республика(здесь нет Федэля :D), забавные люди, все чистенько, куча денег в мусорках. И парочка СУМАШДЩИХ УЧЕНЫХ, как же она будут вам всю игру надоедать, но без них игра не была бы такой интересной, всегда слушайте, что говорят они и собирайте голософоны(аудозаписи)!

Так же есть куча тайничков, которык отлично разбавляют перестрелки(от некоторых кстати на уровне "Сложно" у вас будет пригорать пукан). Аи весьма скудный, но бронебойные просто ужас, пока непрокачаете оружие и спелы, будеть терпеть, и тратить на 1 врага кучу патронов, ох об этой игре можно говорить вечно, слишком много всего, а я бы хотел заострить внимание на одном персонаже конечно же...

[u]...на Элизабет! [/u]

Сексопильная молодая девочка (спойлер: [spoiler] дочь главного героя Букера [/spoiler], так что не особенно увлекайтесь фантазиями :D), изначальная цель игры в поиске этой девчонки, она весьма неординарная(как внешне так и внутренне), вокруг нее вертиться все, мир, время, погода, жизнь... А проработка эмоций ее лица просто бесподобна, иной раз вы будете ловить себя на том, что уже 5 минут смотрите тупо ей в глаза) Сколько слез, улыбок, ненависти и фраз "Букер" прольется на вас, как же это клево... 

Вообщем не задумываясь начинайте играть, это отличная игра, и вас ждет заманчивая концовка

SHEDEVER BLYA

Wow. Triple A.
This game is as near to perfection as any game should hope for. An entirely engaging combat system, a story that will have you in shock and awe, and a completely immersive world driven by a supreme graphics engine.
The story alone is worth $20 bucks on a paperback. I picked this up for a dub, ended up buying the season pass, which I must say just adds to the experience and does not deviate from the main story as most dlc does. 
The graphics really tested my system and were rendered beautifully (OC'd SLI 770s watercooled). Would definately recommend an upper end system if you want this game in all its supreme glory.
Combat was common of an FPS... on the FPS side of things, but the vigors added some fun to the "normal" point and click style we are all used to.
I don't believe in perfect 10s... but you can't argue with the facts.
If you like a game where the story takes upp 70% (a number i dragged out of my ass) of the time and shooting is pretty OK (if you like hit-scan), this game is for you. It is kinda pretty after all.
